heisigStory: As we have already learned characters for poem (Frame 370), chant (Frame 21), and song (Frame 508), it is important to protect this key word with an image all its own. Its elements are the same as those above; only the position has changed: mouth . . . clock.
koohiiStory1: Versify this kanji as follows: Hickery dickery dock, the mouth ran by the clock.
koohiiStory2: To versify, words of rhythm needs to shoot out of your MOUTH with a CLOCK-like regularity.
